result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy M. Schulze

records.addlTxt: No contact whatsoever with victim or victim's residence.

2:51 PM/ RM 301.  Defendant Timothy M. Schulze appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Court questions State on penalties, State responds. Court advises Def. to contact PD Office as soon as possible. State notes Def. probation agent has advised proceeding with revocation and notes Def. is currently on a probation hold. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $100,000.00 cash bond with conditions of No contact with victim or victim's residence. Def. has no argument. Court considers factors and orders a $100,000.00 cash bond with conditions of No contact whatsoever with victim or victim's residence. Court notes Def. can contact Judge's JA to have bond reviewed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
